alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:42AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern McCurtain County through 515 AM CDT... At 441 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Cloudy, or 24 miles northeast of Hugo, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rufe, Bethel, Battiest, Pickens, Ringold, Mount Herman and Sherwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma.
